cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 7th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British Front. On the SOMME front we have taken HANCOURT, TINCOURT, SOREL-LE-GRAND and METZ, but have not taken FINS.
We have also made progress in the south-western portion of HAVRINCOURT WOOD.
North of HILL 63, in a small operation last night, we took about 50 prisoners and made a little ground.
(b) French Front. On the French front north of the AISNE the line runs CELLES, (exclusive), NANTEUIL - LA-FOSSE, (inclusive), LAFFAUX, (exclusive), VAUXAILLON, (exclusive), COURSON, QUINCY, (both inclusive), thence along the old front line to west of FRESNES, thence to station in the middle of FORET DE COUCY, SINCENY, VIRY-NOUREUIL, UGNY, VILLESELVE, BROUCHY, ESTOUILLY, VILLERS ST. CHRISTOPHE, FORESTE, LANCHY, all inclusive.
ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
7th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.30 p.m.
